Detailed Description

This provides a number of optional tools for working with a phys::World.

Currently this allows for more seamless mouse use, including 'picking' of objects with the mouse, and associated functionality.

Vector3WActor * phys::WorldQueryTool::GetActorUnderMouse ( Real  RayLength = 1000.0,
bool  UsePolygon = true 
)

This will find the actor under the mouse.

This will use

Parameters:
UsePolygon If true this will use GetFirstActorOnRayByPolygon, otherwise this will use GetFirstActorOnRayByAABB .
RayLength The length of the ray to cast from te mouse to search for actors. This defaults to 1000.0
Returns:
This returns a Vector3WActor which has a pointer to the actor under the mouse, and a vector representing the distance of the mouse fromt the center of mass.

Definition at line 185 of file worldquerytool.cpp.

Vector3WActor * phys::WorldQueryTool::GetFirstActorOnRayByAABB ( Ray  ActorRay  ) 

Partially implemented. This should find the first Actor that is on or almost on the a given Ray.

This casts a ray through the gameworld. The first actor with an Axis Aligned Bounding Box that intersects that ray is returned. Presently this is untested and does not return the Offset of the intersection. This should perform faster than WorldQueryTool::GetFirstActorOnRayByPolygon but not by a known amount.

Parameters:
ActorRay The Ray to search along.
Returns:
This returns a pointer to an actorbase, which is the first actor to have an Axis-Aligned Bounding Box along the ray.

Todo:
TODO: The function WorldQueryTool::GetFirstActorOnRayByAABB does not return an valid offset. This needs to be calculated somehow.
Todo:
TODO: The function WorldQueryTool::GetFirstActorOnRayByAABB has not been tested and needs to be tested

Definition at line 152 of file worldquerytool.cpp.

Vector3WActor * phys::WorldQueryTool::GetFirstActorOnRayByPolygon ( Ray  ActorRay  ) 

This will find the first Actor to intesect the Given ray.

This use the graphics subsystem to cast a ray in the world. If the ray passes through any the triangles in an actor This will return that actor. This function runs in linear time relative to the amount of triangles in 3d meshes near the the ray being cast. This will start at ray.from and go to ray.to .

Parameters:
ActorRay The Ray to search along.
Returns:
This returns a pointer to an Vector3WActor, which contains the first actor along the ray and the point of intersection Relative to the actor

Definition at line 70 of file worldquerytool.cpp.

Ray * phys::WorldQueryTool::GetMouseRay ( Real  Length = 1000  ) 

Get a Ray from the current viewport, following the mouse.

This calls on the graphics subsystem to get a ray from the location of the current camera

Parameters:
Length how long of a ray do you want? Thsi defaults to 1000
Returns:
This returns a ray that matches originates at the camera and goes out in 3d space behind the mouse pointer.

Definition at line 301 of file worldquerytool.cpp.

Vector3 * phys::WorldQueryTool::RayPlaneIntersection ( const Ray &  QueryRay,
const Plane &  QueryPlane 
)

Where does this Ray Meet this Plane?

This does some fancy math to return the point where the ray and the plane intersent. This returns a NULL pointer in the event the ray and plane do not meet, or are completely coterminous.

Parameters:
QueryRay This is the Ray that could intersent the plane
QueryPlane This is the plane to be interesected.
Returns:
This returns a pointer to a vector that matches where the intersection of the plane and Ray, if possible
